alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Boyd, Lawrence, southern Carter and western Wayne Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 856 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Wagner, or 7 miles east of Morehead, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Louisa, Wayne, Blaine, Grayson Lake State Park, Yatesville Lake State Park, Fort Gay, Webbville, Denton, Burnaugh, Martha, Durbin, Ulysses, Charley, Centerville, Dunlow, Lockwood, Glenhayes, Hitchins, Soldier and Genoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and central and western West Virginia.
